content: Proclamation against Tyre
In the eleventh year, on the first day of the month, the word of the  came to me:
Mortal, because Tyre said concerning Jerusalem,
â€œAha, broken is the gateway of the peoples;
I shall be replenished,
therefore, thus says the Lord :
See, I am against you, O Tyre!
They shall destroy the walls of Tyre
I will scrape its soil from it
It shall become, in the midst of the sea,
I have spoken, says the Lord .
It shall become plunder for the nations,
Then they shall know that I am the .
For thus says the Lord : I will bring against Tyre from the north King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon, king of kings, together with horses, chariots, cavalry, and a great and powerful army.
Your daughter-towns in the country
He shall set up a siege wall against you,
He shall direct the shock of his battering rams against your walls
His horses shall be so many
At the noise of cavalry, wheels, and chariots
when he enters your gates
With the hoofs of his horses
He shall put your people to the sword,
They will plunder your riches
they shall break down your walls
Your stones and timber and soil
I will silence the music of your songs;
I will make you a bare rock;
You shall never again be rebuilt,
Thus says the Lord  to Tyre: Shall not the coastlands shake at the sound of your fall, when the wounded groan, when slaughter goes on within you?

Then all the princes of the sea shall step down from their thrones; they shall remove their robes and strip off their embroidered garments. They shall clothe themselves with trembling, and shall sit on the ground; they shall tremble every moment, and be appalled at you.
And they shall raise a lamentation over you, and say to you:
How you have vanished from the seas,
once mighty on the sea,
who imposed your terror
Now the coastlands tremble
the coastlands by the sea
For thus says the Lord : When I make you a city laid waste, like cities that are not inhabited, when I bring up the deep over you, and the great waters cover you,

then I will thrust you down with those who descend into the Pit, to the people of long ago, and I will make you live in the world below, among primeval ruins, with those who go down to the Pit, so that you will not be inhabited or have a place in the land of the living.
I will bring you to a dreadful end, and you shall be no more; though sought for, you will never be found again, says the Lord .
